form.name: form1

div.style: position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; background: #FFFFFF;

p.span: The Walton Central School District is closed to students through May 15, 2020.
For updates on the COVID-19 situation, please visit:

div.div: Our Mission: Teaching, Learning, Caring, & Growing... Together

br.span: Updates for the Walton Central School District for April 9, 2020.
Attached is a letter from the Walton CSD Board of education about the ongoing COVID-19 situation.

div.span: Second Superintendent search survey now available

br.span:
The Walton Central School District has released a survey that will determine the questions used with finalist candidates for the next WCS Superintendent. These questions will be ones used for the community forums on April 29-30.
The survey is intended for only Walton school district residents, students, and district employees. Your participation and opinion matter to us. Thank you for taking the time to fill out the survey.
The survey will remain open until Friday, April 3.
Please note, the listening sessions scheduled for March 31 have been postponed.
To access the survey, please visit: https://forms.gle/pLsoxnwmnHkTy9ym8.
For any question, please call 607-865-4116, ext. 6130. If a hard copy is needed, please contact the district office at the number above to make arrangements.
This update is also going out as a school messenger, and covers meal delivery/pickup, as well as schoolwork.

The Walton Central School District will be watching the weather on Monday, March 23. We still plan on delivering meals, but it’s possible the deliveries will be at a later time than normal. Curbside and walk-up meals will be available at the regular time (11 a.m.-12:30 p.m. at the HS/MS and Townsend).

The Walton Central School District wanted to give a quick update for Wednesday, March 18. First, we want to thank everybody for their patience and support throughout this time. Our community will get through this together!
First, we want to announce that WCS will be fully closed on Friday, March 20.

a.title:
PLEASE NOTE: Board of Education and committee meetings are now being conducted remotely. 

The meeting will be livestreamed and may be viewed on the district's YouTube channel:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeNyGfgqoZkRPqVwVc3VD1g
  
Public comment may be submitted by emailing BOE@waltoncsd.org or by calling the district clerk at 607-865-4116 ext 6130.  Items requiring response will be addressed at the following regularly scheduled business meeting.

Items to be discussed in public session will be posted on BoardDocs accessible through the school website Board of Education page prior to the regular meeting: https://go.boarddocs.com/ny/waltoncsd/Board.nsf/Public  Starting at: 6:00 PM

It is anticipated the Board will immediately convene an executive session both nights for the purpose of discussing matters relating to the future employment of particular persons.
